result.execSummary:
The defendant Jake Richard Berg was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant appears in person with Attorney Osborne.  Defendant waives reading.  Court advises of charges and penalties.  Defendant stands mute.  Court enters Not Guilty plea on behalf of defendant.

Defendant appears in person with Attorney Osborne.  Court gives the right to Preliminary Hearing.  Defendant waives the right to Preliminary Hearing.  Court finds probable cause and binds defendant over for trial.  Information filed.
Defendant appears  in person with Attorney Osborne.  Court modifies bond to $1,500 Signature Bond with the same conditions as the previous bond.  Court to schedule a felony plea.

May not possess or consume a controlled substance without a valid prescription in own name and take as prescribed by a licensed provider.
May not possess drug paraphernalia.
May not be present where controlled substance is illegally sold or consumed.
May not have contact with drug dealers or drug users.
DEFENDANT MUST COMPLY WITH THE BOND MONITORING PROGRAM.  UPON SIGNING OF THE BOND, DEFENDANT MUST APPEAR AT THE JUSTICE PROGRAM OFFICE TO SIGN UP DURING THE HOURS OF 8:00 A.M. - 4:30 P.M.  THE JUSTICE PROGRAM OFFICE IS LOCATED AT 919 HOESCHLER DRIVE, SUITE 100, SPARTA, WI.
Curfew 7pm-7am except for employment purposes or treatment purposes as approved by the Bond Monitoring Program.
Defendant can only be released Monday-Friday, 8am-3:30pm, so defendant can sign up for the Bond Monitoring Program.
